title: The Impregnable Fortress
opening: At Gronder Field, the armies of the Kingdom, Alliance, and Empire collide. The three forces engage in a fierce battle, each suffering significant losses before deciding to withdraw. Seeing an opportunity, the resistance army quickly plots an invasion of Imperial territory. In order to gain a foothold in the Empire, they will attempt to capture Fort Merceus.
Fort Merceus, said to be impregnable, lies between you and Enbarr, the Imperial Capital. Seizing the sturdy fortress will require a carefully devised strategy.

dialogue.speaker: Church Soldier
dialogue.line: Emergency! In Gronder Field... There's a... It's...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: We are in the middle of a military conference. Please calm yourself and tell us what is the matter.

dialogue.speaker: Church Soldier
dialogue.line: Yes, sir! It seems that the Kingdom and Alliance armies clashed with Imperial forces on Gronder Field! Amid the chaos of three armies battling each other out there, the Imperial army was routed! Edelgard sustained heavy wounds and retreated to Enbarr!

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Well then! I suppose...

dialogue.speaker: Church Soldier
dialogue.line: Sir! The Kingdom army was also decimated and... His Highness, Dimitri, has been counted among the dead.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: What?!

dialogue.speaker: Church Soldier
dialogue.line: The Alliance sustained heavy casualties as well. And the whereabouts of their leader, Claude, is currently unknown.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Unknown? I...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Edelgard is injured...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Dimitri is dead...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Claude is missing...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: It must have been a brutal fight. To have lost His Highness... How tragic. Our only solace is that Edelgard sustained severe injuries. This is all quite unexpected, but we must find a way to use this situation to our advantage. The Empire's main force has suffered a mighty blow. Edelgard will most certainly avoid the front lines. Now is the time for us to infiltrate the Empire and aim for the capital.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: But...what will happen to the lords of the old Kingdom and Alliance territories?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: They have lost many leaders and soldiers. I am sure they must be hard at work rebuilding. We will foster cooperation by aiding them through the local churches. The remaining lords of the Kingdom and Alliance must join together to form one union. And you should be the one to lead them... What do you say?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: In time...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I can't decide that just yet.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Indeed. It is a question for another day. We must focus on our battle with the Empire. For now, what is our next course of action?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: We should set out.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Let's decide where to invade first.

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: We must choose a place within the Empire that will give us solid defenses for our front line... That will become the foothold for our invasion of the capital. There is one massive fortress that boasts the greatest defenses in the Empire...Fort Merceus. But we will stand no chance if we attack by traditional means. We must gather everyone and devise a plan of attack.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: ... It has been a lifetime... Hasn't it, Professor?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I thought you were dead.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Yes... I thought so too. I wanted to slice her throat...but I did not get the chance. I let people die, and yet... I still stand. Rodrigue, Gustave, Dedue...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: There must be a reason you survived.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: You sound just like Rodrigue. A reason...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: You can still atone for your sins.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: You sound just like Rodrigue. A way to absolve my sins...

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Everyone gives such complicated advice, and I can never quite grasp it all. That is why... Professor. I came here to explain my decision.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What decision?

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: I have no resources to take back the Kingdom capital, much less to defeat the Empire. And that is why...

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Professor! You will catch a cold sleeping in a place like this. Is something the matter?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Where did he go?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: Hm? I am the only one here. Were you dreaming?

dialogue.speaker: Seteth
dialogue.line: I can't say for certain that you were dreaming, but if someone did come here to see you... That person only wanted you to see their face. Perhaps they wanted you to guide them...

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Dimitri, the late prince of Faerghus. He despised the Empire with all his heart. He should not have tried leading an army while his emotions were holding him captive.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Leaders are people too.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Don't leaders have feelings, like everyone else?

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: True enough, but I suspect the reason he died is that he could not keep his emotions in check. I see. You are saying you met with Dimitri? But you could not tell if it was reality or a dream. Hm. I wonder what it could mean.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I'm rather curious to see what stratagem we'll devise to capture the fortress. You know Fort Merceus's nickname, I assume. The Stubborn Old General? But there must be one or two gaps in its defenses...

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Fort Merceus is next, huh? Ah, the memories. It's a huge stronghold in my father's domain. The town's completely surrounded by high walls. I used to run around there when I was a kid... Way back when a fortress was a playground for me. Yeah, those were the days.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: It's always so peaceful coming back here. But it's hard to relax knowing we have to go out on another expedition again so soon. And assaulting that huge keep? That sounds hard. Oh, really, hard! Don't you think it'll be hard?!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's going to be tough.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: I knew you'd think so! I knew you-- Ow! Oh, ow. Can't believe I tried to hug you through the door...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll be fine.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Of course you'd say that! Why'd I even ask?!

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: I heard that a staggering number of people lost their loves in the battle at Gronder. And here we are, preparing for the next battle, as if nothing happened the day before. It's almost easier to think about war as theater, with the stage an entire continent.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Though actors die, the show goes on?

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Something like that. If an accident happens on stage, the next day's performance must be unaffected.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It really doesn't seem like theater.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Even if an accident happens on stage, the next day you have to sing as though nothing happened.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Everyone just pretends like everything is fine... focusing on their role in the play.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I have excitement in my heart for secret tactics! I enjoy attacks that are surprising.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Why's that?

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Surprise attacks are safe with friends. Fewer injuries.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Because it's like hunting?

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Yes. Hunting is doing surprise attacks on prey. Surprise attacks are safe with friends. Fewer injuries.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: It hasn't sunk in yet. They slaughtered the boar... I can hardly believe it. I thought he was alive all this time. He must have really hated Edelgard to lead such an ill-advised assault. Hmph. No point in feeling sorry for the poor scoundrel now.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: I've heard Dedue's passed on. Just like His Highness.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can't know that for certain.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: That's true. I did hear that his body was never found.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Don't believe everything you hear.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: You're right. I don't think anyone's found his body, so I guess he might still be out there.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Dedue is dead?

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: That's what I've heard. But no one's found his body.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: If, somehow, he's still alive...I hope we'll meet again.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Ya know, Professor, laying siege to a keep is like asking a girl out on a date. First, you get past her defenses...then you make your move.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's not the best analogy.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Trust me, I know what I'm talking about. I'm a seasoned veteran at this kind of thing. Girls, I mean . I've never actually, you know, captured any keeps...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You might be right.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Ha! I knew you'd get it, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Anyway, you know more about tactics than me, so I don't know why I'm offering you advice.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Oh, Goddess, hear my prayer. Please bless the deceased with peace everlasting... And may his soul rest in tranquility. You know, I used to see him praying quite often when I would come to the cathedral at night. I wonder who it was he prayed for back then...

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Professor. They tell me my father died at Gronder. Was that... Was that really a fitting end for one such as him? I don't know. I just...don't know.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: I only know what little I overheard. But what I did hear implied that the Empire was involved in the Tragedy of Duscur. If it's true, that may explain why His Highness chose to fight the Empire. Perhaps I should have fought alongside His Highness.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Why is that?

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Because...I too, lost someone to that tragedy--the most important person in my world.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Are you having regrets?

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: No. Not anymore. I am where I belong.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Those of us still on this plane of existence will carry on the torch. The inhumane actions of the Empire must not be repeated.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Fort Merceus is old and strong. It's reputation for durability is equal to that of Arianrhod. Are you certain your plan is sufficient? It seems to be a little simplistic.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Guess we'll find out.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: That's not terrifically reassuring! Shouldn't you have more faith in your own plans?!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll be fine.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: I suppose I must take you at your word, mustn't I?

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Incidentally, have you heard any news of Claude? I, for one, have a hard time believing he is dead. He was always a clever and tenacious sort.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: You know when you work your muscles and they start screaming? That means you gotta be nice to them. If you're muscles are hungry, you gotta feed them, and let them rest when they're tired.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't see how you'd do that.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Whaddya mean, how? You just gotta eat and sleep! It's pretty obvious...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You can tell how your muscles are feeling?

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Of course! If my muscles hurt, then I hurt. If they're hungry, well then I'm hungry too!

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: What's with the confused face, Professor? You look like you don't get a word I'm saying!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: It sounds like the battle at Gronder Field was pretty gruesome. We don't know for certain whether Claude's alive or dead. Maybe he's all right? I wish I could make sure somehow. But it doesn't seem possible now.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: If Claude somehow survived, I imagine he's terribly wounded. All three forces have suffered heavy losses. We're incredibly lucky to have not been involved. This is a perfect and unique opportunity to go on the offense. Now is the time to prove ourselves, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I never used to care whether I lived or died... But when I think of all those who died at Gronder, I realize how precious life truly is. I'm ashamed of how arrogant I was to think that death could mean so little...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: I like this idea of yours--dressing as Imperial soldiers so they'll let us in. But don't you wish there was one more twist in the plan? Come on, Professor, think! How could we add another wrinkle, hm?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can dress you as the emperor.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Dress me as Edelgard?! But we look nothing alike!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We could dress Seteth as a woman.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Seteth, dressed as a woman? I don't understand what the point of that would be.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: On second thought, let's just stick to the plan as originally conceived. That seems safer.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Under your leadership, we can win any battle, no matter the odds. That's what everyone's saying anyway. Hope you can keep up with our expectations, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: The battle at Gronder Field certainly took an unexpected turn, did it not? Let us press on, so as not to waste the opportunity. Fort Merceus is a keep that was constructed to defend the Imperial Capital, Enbarr. We cannot enter the capital without first capturing that fort. But once we have it, the city should be almost entirely at our mercy. I will make the necessary preparations. Be ready.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Standing face to face with those whom I went to school with. On the field of battle... How inhuman war is--how horrifying. My heart feels shattered. It is my hope that this war marks the end of such foolish behavior.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Fort Merceus is the Empire's single most fortified military installation. Utterly impregnable, they say. I wonder, do you happen to know the nickname given to Fort Merceus?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The Silver Maiden.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: No, I'm afraid that name refers to the Fortress City of Arianrhod.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Fódlan's Locket.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: That one is a fortress that stands at Fódlan's Throat.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The Stubborn Old General.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Indeed! A very good answer, but of course you'd know that.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Seems Fódlans give everyone and everything a nickname. Why, you were called the Ashen Demon! Myself, I have been called the Father of Crestology, which is a nickname as well as a title, I suppose...

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Each step closer to Enbarr, I'm reminded of another part of my past. Riches and poverty, glory and failure, that city has it all. And if I'm honest...sometimes I miss it. That's how the past works though, isn't it? It's always a different story than what you really lived.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: You're quite a tactician! Disguising ourselves as enemy soldiers to sneak in, undetected. A stroke of brilliance. In a frontal attack, our losses would be tremendous. With this strategy, we can really snatch victory from the jaws of...deceit!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's a good point.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Yes... With you leading our fighters, I've no doubt the Empire will suffer an embarrassing deceit. Get it? Deceit? Again?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's a bad pun.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Ah, rats! You've seen through my cunning punning!

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: I hardly recognize everyone... Their faces have changed so much. More experience in the eyes, and more pain. I'm glad that they're stronger, but I hate to think they've all become hardened killers. Look after them, OK? Try to keep 'em on the straight-and-narrow.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Did you give the ridiculous order to prepare Imperial armor for every one of our troops? I've reached out through all my channels, but there are limits to these things. I'll have to recruit an entire town's worth of people if I ever plan on making enough.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Guess what I noticed. I can see further than most other people can see. But I can't figure the point of seeing further than an arrow can fly, since I can't shoot what I see.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You could detect enemy movements in advance.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: I suppose I could see a whole horde of enemies coming and run away. That's kinda useful at least.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You could find our targets quicker than anyone.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Yeah, I suppose it could be real useful for finding Lady Rhea too.

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: A Class reunion on the battlefield? That's...bleak. That must've been so hard on everyone. You gotta keep looking after them all. I mean, they still look to you for guidance, you know?

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Is it true that we'll be assaulting Fort Merceus next? That doesn't sound like the brightest idea... I've heard that it's built to withstand an attack from even the largest of armies! Not to tell you how to do your job, but don't do it! I'm not ready to say my final good-byes to everyone...

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: We are just about to pass through Gronder Field. We should be in view of Fort Merceus soon. It looks like the battle made quite an impact... The Imperial Army has lost some of its luster. We should soon be able to invade the fort without too much trouble.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Because of the Alliance and Kingdom's sacrifices...

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Yes, we must win for them as well.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We cannot let this opportunity pass us by.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Yes, after a few short months, they will already be back on their feet. We cannot waste this opportunity.

intro.speaker: Ferdinand
intro.line: Professor, the soldiers have finished changing into their disguises. We are ready to masquerade as Imperial troops and infiltrate the fort.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Disguises?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Infiltrate the fort?

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: I believe this was your idea, was it not? It is impossible to take Fort Merceus with a frontal assault. We must take it from within. We will infiltrate the fort as Imperial troops and kill the enemy general. All preparations are complete.

intro.speaker: Caspar
intro.line: According to the scout reports, my father and the others are not inside the fort. It seems they were moved to the front lines of the Kingdom's western region.

intro.speaker: Church Soldier
intro.line: The Death Knight became the general of this fort after the battle at Gronder Field.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: What?! The Death Knight?! I think I'll be taking a break now... You guys go on ahead.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: Bernadetta, you cannot be hiding on a field. The enemy will be seeing you.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: No place to hide?! I guess... I have no choice but to fight!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: The Death Knight... I hear that he is counted among the greatest heroes of the Empire at the moment. We never determined whether or not he was truly Jeritza. So in capturing Merceus, we have encountered another obstacle.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We've beaten him before.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: I suppose you have a point. If we challenge him again with conviction, we are sure to attain victory.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's be careful.

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Yes, now more than ever.

intro.speaker: Linhardt
intro.line: The Impenetrable Fortress City of Arianrhod goes by the name Silver Maiden. Yet she pales in comparison to Fort Merceus--the Stubborn Old General. Those who approach are driven back, but once we make our way in, it's all ours.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: That fort has been brought to life on stage for countless operas...

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Let us commence. We must puncture a hole in the Empire's defenses!

intro.speaker: Death Knight
intro.line: That man/woman approaches... Will death's scythe claim you... Or will I fall to that sword of yours...

battle.speaker: Imperial Soldier
battle.line: Report! A group posing as Imperial soldiers has infiltrated! They seem to be affiliated with the church!

battle.speaker: Death Knight
battle.line: Close the gates. Leave no survivors.

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: Do not let him get away! Circle around and cut off his retreat!

battle.speaker: Death Knight
battle.line: The time of ruin draws near... But their slaughter must wait until next we meet...

battle.speaker: Seteth
battle.line: He's fled, has he? Let us deal with the remaining foes and then make haste in our pursuit!

boss.speaker: Mercedes
boss.line: No! I won't! I... I refuse to run from you anymore!

boss.speaker: Flayn
boss.line: So it's you, Death Knight! Remember me?!

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: You again. Here to lose more blood?

boss.speaker: Flayn
boss.line: Never! You will not lay a hand on me ever again

boss.speaker: Seteth
boss.line: You will not escape, Death Knight. Today you will be unmasked!

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: My true identity has no value.

boss.speaker: Seteth
boss.line: I will be the judge of that, once I've seen your face.

boss.speaker: Death Knight
boss.line: If you desire to slay me, follow. The appointed hour is at hand...

cutscene.speaker: Death Knight
cutscene.line: It is coming... Leave now or all of you will die.

cutscene.speaker: Alliance Soldier In Imperial Gear
cutscene.line: Run! We have to evacuate immediately!

cutscene.speaker: Alliance Armoured Soldier
cutscene.line: The fort, it's... It's just... gone.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Whatever could that have been... It was almost reminiscent of that terror of legend...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What legend?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: We haven't the time for stories...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: We need to get out of here.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Agreed. We must retreat for now.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: All we can do is retreat to the Great Bridge of Myrddin and assess our situation.

end.speaker: Manuela
end.line: Well now, that marching was nearly as trying as the battle itself.

end.speaker: Hanneman
end.line: We wasted a few days, but now that we're this far back, we should be safe... Or so I believe.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: I still can't believe it. The fort was destroyed, just like that...

end.speaker: Shamir
end.line: The Death Knight knew about the attack. Was it the Empire's doing?

end.speaker: Cyril
end.line: Guess that means they'd rather destroy the fort than lose it.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Whatever the case, we need to get our bearings and decide what we're going to do next.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: We all have many questions, but for now, we must focus on our next move.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Let's give up.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: What?! How could... Ah. Yes, I see.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Let's attack the Imperial capital.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: I wish for that as well, but we are sure to fall if we charge in without a plan. Hmm... But by the look on your face, I have the feeling you are working out a plan even now.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Let's return to the monastery.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: What?! If we return to the monastery, then our situation is sure to... Ah. Yes, I see...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Now you've got it.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Whatever do you mean?

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: No need to hide your intentions from me.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: So, we make it appear as though we have ceased our invasion by returning to Garreg Mach. Then we divide up our soldiers and infiltrate nearby areas of the capital right under the Empire's nose. Finally, we gather all of the soldiers somewhere we can get to swiftly from Garreg Mach and proceed to invade Enbarr. Is that what you are thinking?

end.speaker: Caspar
end.line: Are you serious? You know there's no guarantee that we won't be spotted by the enemy, right?

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: If we fail to intervene, we will be isolated inside the Empire and be...utterly obliterated.

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: I will be embracing the nearness of death if I am needing to. With each other!

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: That sounds dangerous...really, incredibly dangerous!

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: Make no mistake...if we fail in this plan, there will be no coming back from it. Are you sure about this, Professor?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It's our only hope.

end.speaker: Seteth
end.line: I see. If you are resolved, then I will follow suit. We may be weaker and the terrain may be against us, but all we can do is use our resources the best we can. That, and pray for the blessings of the goddess.
